TEXT: The applicant , who qualified as a doctor in GPE , worked as a general practitioner ( “ GPE ” ) in GPE , GPE from DATE until the events described below . In DATE he developed a depressive illness as a result of financial pressures .

On DATE an incident occurred when a patient , PERSON , then aged DATE , was consulting the applicant at his surgery . The applicant had been treating PERSON for , inter alia , pelvic infection , irritable bowel syndrome and lower back pain , and on DATE in question examined her internally and asked her to perform a back exercise on the floor ( referred to by PERSON as “ the cat ” ) . On DATE Ms H complained to the police that the applicant had indecently assaulted her during a consultation at his surgery on DATE , and on a number of other occasions over DATE . She alleged , inter alia , that on DATE the applicant had conducted an improper examination on the couch , inserting his fingers into her anus and vagina simultaneously while pressing his erection against her , and that he had rubbed her vagina while she , naked from the waist down , was carrying out the “ cat ” exercise on the floor . On DATE PERSON , wearing a concealed tape recorder fitted by the police , visited the applicant and complained about the incident in question . The relevant parts of the transcript of the tape recording of this conversation read as follow :
“ O : ... Are you coming just for a check - up or there 's a new problem you want to tell me about ?
H : Erm I 've come to ask you erm a few questions .
H : Erm it 's about my internal examinations .
H : Erm when you , I like feel a bit funny about when you do them . Erm you do the front and then you do the back ,
H : and then sometimes you do the front as well and I feel like it 's causing me to -
O : No , does n't because I use different fingers to start with . [ Further discussion about likelihood of examinations causing infection ]
